SOS eu competition law has its origins in the european coal and steel community -lrb- UNK -rrb- agreement between france , italy , belgium , the netherlands , luxembourg and germany in 1951 following the second world war . EOS
SOS eu competition law has its origins in the european coal and steel community -lrb- UNK -rrb- agreement between france , italy , belgium , the netherlands , luxembourg and germany in 1951 following the second world war . EOS
SOS article 65 of the agreement banned cartels and article 66 made provisions for concentrations , or mergers , and the abuse of a dominant position by companies . EOS
SOS article 65 of the agreement banned cartels and article 66 made provisions for concentrations , or mergers , and the abuse of a dominant position by companies . EOS
SOS in 1957 competition rules were included in the treaty of rome , also known as the ec treaty , which established the european economic community -lrb- eec -rrb- . EOS
SOS today , the treaty of lisbon prohibits UNK agreements in article 101 -lrb- 1 -rrb- , including price fixing . EOS
SOS article 102 prohibits the abuse of dominant position , such as price discrimination and exclusive dealing . EOS
SOS articles 106 and 107 provide that member state 's right to deliver public services may not be obstructed , but that otherwise public enterprises must adhere to the same competition principles as companies . EOS
SOS article 102 allows the european council to regulations to govern mergers between firms -lrb- the current regulation is the regulation UNK -rrb- . EOS
SOS while the concept of a " social market economy " was only introduced into eu law in 2007 , free movement and trade were central to european development since the treaty of rome 1957 . EOS
SOS while the concept of a " social market economy " was only introduced into eu law in 2007 , free movement and trade were central to european development since the treaty of rome 1957 . EOS
SOS like in other regional organisations such as the north american free trade association , or the world trade organisation , breaking down barriers to trade , and enhancing free movement of goods , services , labour and capital , is meant to reduce consumer prices . EOS
SOS the treaties limit free trade , to UNK other values such as public health , consumer protection , labour rights , fair competition , and environmental improvement . EOS
SOS increasingly the court of justice has taken the view that the specific goals of free trade are underpinned by the general aims of the treaty for improvement of people 's well being . EOS
SOS free movement of goods within the european union is achieved by a customs union , and the principle of non-discrimination . EOS
SOS it discriminated against parallel UNK like mr UNK , who could not get certificates from authorities in france , where they bought the UNK . EOS
SOS it also means states can be responsible for private actors . EOS
SOS for instance , in commission v france french farmer vigilantes were continually UNK shipments of spanish strawberries , and even belgian tomato imports . EOS
SOS so , in UNK v austria the court of justice held that austria did not infringe article 34 by failing to ban a protest that blocked heavy traffic passing over the UNK , brenner autobahn , en route to italy . EOS
SOS in the most famous case UNK ag v UNK fr UNK , the court of justice found that a german law requiring all spirits and UNK -lrb- not just imported ones -rrb- to have a minimum alcohol content of 25 per cent was contrary to tfeu article 34 , because it had a greater negative effect on imports . EOS
SOS german UNK were over 25 per cent alcohol , but UNK de dijon , which UNK ag wished to import from france , only had 15 to 20 per cent alcohol . EOS
SOS in a 2003 case , commission v italy italian law required that cocoa products that included other vegetable fats could not be labelled as " chocolate " . EOS
SOS all italian chocolate was made from cocoa butter alone , but british , danish and irish manufacturers used other vegetable fats . EOS
SOS so , in a 2009 case , commission v italy , the court of justice held that an italian law prohibiting motorcycles or UNK pulling trailers infringed article 34 . EOS
SOS in UNK and UNK two UNK claimed that their prosecution under a french competition law , which prevented them selling UNK beer under wholesale price , was unlawful . EOS
SOS the aim of the law was to prevent cut throat competition , not to UNK trade . EOS
SOS in UNK v de UNK the court of justice reviewed swedish bans on advertising to children under age 12 , and misleading commercials for skin care products . EOS
SOS under the unfair commercial practices directive , the eu harmonised restrictions on restrictions on marketing and advertising , to forbid conduct that distorts average consumer behaviour , is misleading or aggressive , and sets out a list of examples that count as unfair . EOS
SOS since its foundation , the treaties sought to enable people to pursue their life goals in any country through free movement . EOS
SOS reflecting the economic nature of the project , the european community originally focused upon free movement of workers : as a " factor of production " . EOS
SOS free movement was increasingly based on " citizenship " , so that people had rights to UNK them to become economically and socially active , rather than economic activity being a UNK for rights . EOS
SOS for example , in UNK v UNK van UNK , a german man claimed the right to residence in the netherlands , while he volunteered plumbing and household duties in the UNK community , which provided for everyone 's material needs irrespective of their contributions . EOS
SOS the court of justice held that mr UNK was entitled to stay , so long as there was at least an " indirect quid pro quo " for the work he did . EOS
SOS the free movement of workers regulation articles 1 to 7 set out the main provisions on equal treatment of workers . EOS
SOS in a famous case , the belgian football association v UNK , a belgian footballer named UNK UNK claimed that he should be able to transfer from r.f.c . de lige to usl UNK when his contract finished , regardless of whether UNK could afford to pay lige the habitual transfer fees . EOS
SOS in UNK v minister for education the court of justice accepted that a requirement to speak gaelic to teach in a dublin design college could be justified as part of the public policy of promoting the irish language , but only if the measure was not disproportionate . EOS
SOS in hendrix v employee insurance institute the court of justice held that a dutch national was not entitled to continue receiving UNK benefits when he moved to belgium , because the benefit was " closely linked to the socio-economic situation " of the netherlands . EOS
SOS conversely , in UNK v land nordrhein-westfalen the court of justice held that a dutch woman living in the netherlands , but working between 3 and 14 hours a week in germany , did not have a right to receive german child benefits , even though the wife of a man who worked full-time in germany but was resident in austria could . EOS
SOS citizenship of the eu has increasingly been seen as a " fundamental " status of member state nationals by the court of justice , and has accordingly increased the number of social services that people can access wherever they move . EOS
SOS citizenship of the eu has increasingly been seen as a " fundamental " status of member state nationals by the court of justice , and has accordingly increased the number of social services that people can access wherever they move . EOS
SOS in commission v austria the court held that austria was not entitled to restrict places in austrian universities to austrian students to avoid " structural , UNK and financial problems " if -lrb- mainly german -rrb- foreign students applied for places because there was little evidence of an actual problem . EOS
SOS the court has required that higher education , along with other forms of vocational training , should be more access , albeit with qualifying periods . EOS
SOS as well as creating rights for " workers " who generally lack bargaining power in the market , the treaty on the functioning of the european union also protects the " freedom of establishment " in article 49 , and " freedom to provide services " in article 56 . EOS
SOS however , the requirements to be registered in milan before being able to practice would be allowed if they were UNK , " justified by imperative requirements in the general interest " and proportionately applied . EOS
SOS in UNK v belgium the court of justice held that a refusal to admit a lawyer to the belgian bar because he lacked belgian nationality was unjustified . EOS
SOS tfeu article 49 says states are exempt from infringing others ' freedom of establishment when they exercise " official authority " , but this did an advocate 's work -lrb- as opposed to a court 's -rrb- was not official . EOS
SOS by contrast in commission v italy the court of justice held that a requirement for lawyers in italy to comply with maximum tariffs unless there was an agreement with a client was not a restriction . EOS
SOS in 2006 , a toxic waste spill off the coast of cte d'ivoire , from a european ship , prompted the commission to look into legislation against toxic waste . EOS
SOS with countries such as spain not even having a crime against shipping toxic waste , franco UNK , the justice , freedom and security commissioner , proposed with UNK to create criminal sentences for " ecological crimes " . EOS
SOS however , in october 2007 , the court of justice ruled that the commission could not propose what the criminal sanctions could be , only that there must be some . EOS
SOS the competence for the union to do this was contested in 2005 at the court of justice resulting in a victory for the commission . EOS
SOS the " freedom to provide services " under tfeu article 56 applies to people who give services " for remuneration " , especially commercial or professional activity . EOS
SOS for example , in van UNK v UNK van de UNK UNK de UNK a dutch lawyer moved to belgium while advising a client in a social security case , and was told he could not continue because dutch law said only people established in the netherlands could give legal advice . EOS
SOS the court of justice reasoned that narcotic drugs were controlled in all member states , and so this differed from other cases where prostitution or other UNK activity was subject to restriction . EOS
SOS the dutch health authorities regarded the treatment unnecessary , so she argued this restricted the freedom -lrb- of the german health clinic -rrb- to provide services . EOS
SOS this meant the daily mail newspaper 's parent company could not evade tax by shifting its residence to the netherlands without first settling its tax bills in the uk . EOS
SOS uk law only required # 1 of capital to start a company , while denmark 's legislature took the view companies should only be started up if they had 200,000 danish UNK -lrb- around $ 27,000 -rrb- to protect creditors if the company failed and went insolvent . EOS
SOS uk law only required # 1 of capital to start a company , while denmark 's legislature took the view companies should only be started up if they had 200,000 danish UNK -lrb- around $ 27,000 -rrb- to protect creditors if the company failed and went insolvent . EOS
SOS although restrictions on freedom of establishment could be justified by UNK protection , labour rights to participate in work , or the public interest in collecting taxes , denial of capacity went too far : it was an " outright negation " of the right of establishment . EOS
SOS similarly in UNK UNK v nordic construction UNK the court of justice held that a german court could not deny a dutch building company the right to enforce a contract in germany on the basis that it was not UNK incorporated in germany . EOS
SOS the amazon rainforest -lrb- portuguese : floresta amaznica or amaznia ; spanish : selva amaznica , amazona or usually amazonia ; french : fort amazonienne ; dutch : amazoneregenwoud -rrb- , also known in english as amazonia or the amazon jungle , is a moist broadleaf forest that covers most of the amazon basin of south america . EOS
SOS this basin encompasses UNK square kilometres -lrb- 2,700,000 sq mi -rrb- , of which UNK square kilometres -lrb- 2,100,000 sq mi -rrb- are covered by the rainforest . EOS
SOS this region includes territory belonging to nine nations . EOS
SOS states or departments in four nations contain " amazonas " in their names . EOS
SOS the amazon represents over half of the planet 's remaining rainforests , and comprises the largest and most biodiverse tract of tropical rainforest in the world , with an estimated 390 billion individual trees divided into 16,000 species . EOS
SOS the amazon rainforest -lrb- portuguese : floresta amaznica or amaznia ; spanish : selva amaznica , amazona or usually amazonia ; french : fort amazonienne ; dutch : amazoneregenwoud -rrb- , also known in english as amazonia or the amazon jungle , is a moist broadleaf forest that covers most of the amazon basin of south america . EOS
SOS the amazon rainforest -lrb- portuguese : floresta amaznica or amaznia ; spanish : selva amaznica , amazona or usually amazonia ; french : fort amazonienne ; dutch : amazoneregenwoud -rrb- , also known in english as amazonia or the amazon jungle , is a moist broadleaf forest that covers most of the amazon basin of south america . EOS
SOS the majority of the forest is contained within brazil , with 60 % of the rainforest , followed by peru with 13 % , colombia with 10 % , and with minor amounts in venezuela , ecuador , bolivia , guyana , suriname and french guiana . EOS
SOS the amazon represents over half of the planet 's remaining rainforests , and comprises the largest and most biodiverse tract of tropical rainforest in the world , with an estimated 390 billion individual trees divided into 16,000 species . EOS

SOS this basin encompasses UNK square kilometres -lrb- 2,700,000 sq mi -rrb- , of which UNK square kilometres -lrb- 2,100,000 sq mi -rrb- are covered by the rainforest . EOS
SOS this region includes territory belonging to nine nations . EOS
SOS the majority of the forest is contained within brazil , with 60 % of the rainforest , followed by peru with 13 % , colombia with 10 % , and with minor amounts in venezuela , ecuador , bolivia , guyana , suriname and french guiana . EOS
SOS the amazon represents over half of the planet 's remaining rainforests , and comprises the largest and most biodiverse tract of tropical rainforest in the world , with an estimated 390 billion individual trees divided into 16,000 species . EOS
SOS following the cretaceous -- paleogene extinction event , the extinction of the dinosaurs and the wetter climate may have allowed the tropical rainforest to spread out across the continent . EOS
SOS climate fluctuations during the last 34 million years have allowed savanna regions to expand into the tropics . EOS
SOS during the oligocene , for example , the rainforest spanned a relatively narrow band . EOS
SOS it expanded again during the middle miocene , then retracted to a mostly inland formation at the last glacial maximum . EOS
SOS however , the rainforest still managed to thrive during these glacial periods , allowing for the survival and evolution of a broad diversity of species . EOS

SOS from 66 -- 34 mya , the rainforest extended as far south as 45 . EOS

SOS during the mid-eocene , it is believed that the drainage basin of the amazon was split along the middle of the continent by the purus arch . EOS
SOS water on the eastern side flowed toward the atlantic , while to the west water flowed toward the pacific across the amazonas basin . EOS
SOS as the andes mountains rose , however , a large basin was created that enclosed a lake ; now known as the solimes basin . EOS
SOS within the last 5 -- 10 million years , this accumulating water broke through the purus arch , joining the easterly flow toward the atlantic . EOS

SOS water on the eastern side flowed toward the atlantic , while to the west water flowed toward the pacific across the amazonas basin . EOS
SOS as the andes mountains rose , however , a large basin was created that enclosed a lake ; now known as the solimes basin . EOS
SOS there is evidence that there have been significant changes in amazon rainforest vegetation over the last 21,000 years through the last glacial maximum -lrb- lgm -rrb- and subsequent deglaciation . EOS
SOS analyses of sediment deposits from amazon basin paleolakes and from the amazon fan indicate that rainfall in the basin during the lgm was lower than for the present , and this was almost certainly associated with reduced moist tropical vegetation cover in the basin . EOS
SOS some scientists argue that the rainforest was reduced to small , isolated refugia separated by open forest and grassland ; other scientists argue that the rainforest remained largely intact but extended less far to the north , south , and east than is seen today . EOS
SOS this debate has proved difficult to resolve because the practical limitations of working in the rainforest mean that data sampling is biased away from the center of the amazon basin , and both explanations are reasonably well supported by the available data . EOS
SOS this debate has proved difficult to resolve because the practical limitations of working in the rainforest mean that data sampling is biased away from the center of the amazon basin , and both explanations are reasonably well supported by the available data . EOS

SOS nasa 's calipso satellite has measured the amount of dust transported by wind from the sahara to the amazon : an average 182 million tons of dust are windblown out of the sahara each year , at 15 degrees west longitude , across 1,600 miles -lrb- 2,600 km -rrb- over the atlantic ocean -lrb- some dust falls into the atlantic -rrb- , then at 35 degrees west longitude at the eastern coast of south america , 27.7 million tons -lrb- 15 % -rrb- of dust fall over the amazon basin , 132 million tons of dust remain in the air , 43 million tons of dust are windblown and falls on the caribbean sea , past 75 degrees west longitude . SOS archeologist betty meggers was a prominent proponent of this idea , as described in her book amazonia : man and culture in a counterfeit paradise . EOS
SOS she claimed that a population density of 0.2 inhabitants per square kilometre -lrb- 0.52 / sq mi -rrb- is the maximum that can be sustained in the rainforest through hunting , with agriculture needed to host a larger population . EOS

SOS ctenophora -lrb- / tnfr / ; singular ctenophore , / tnfr / or / tinfr / ; from the greek kteis ` comb ' and pher ` carry ' ; commonly known as comb jellies -rrb- is a phylum of animals that live in marine waters worldwide . EOS
SOS their most distinctive feature is the ` combs ' -- groups of cilia which they use for swimming -- they are the largest animals that swim by means of cilia . EOS
SOS some authors combined ctenophores and cnidarians in one phylum , UNK , as both groups rely on water flow through the body cavity for both digestion and respiration . EOS

SOS in favorable circumstances , ctenophores can eat ten times their own weight in a day . EOS
SOS the phylum has a wide range of body forms , including the flattened , deep-sea platyctenids , in which the adults of most species lack combs , and the coastal beroids , which lack tentacles and prey on other ctenophores by using huge mouths armed with groups of large , stiffened cilia that act as teeth . SOS most species are hermaphrodites -- a single animal can produce both eggs and sperm , meaning it can UNK its own egg , not needing a mate . EOS
SOS the young are generally planktonic and in most species look like miniature cydippids , gradually changing into their adult shapes as they grow . EOS
SOS in at least some species , juveniles are capable of reproduction before reaching the adult size and shape . EOS
SOS some are simultaneous hermaphrodites , which can produce both eggs and sperm at the same time . EOS
SOS others are sequential hermaphrodites , in which the eggs and sperm mature at different times . EOS
SOS fertilization is generally external , although platyctenids ' eggs are fertilized inside their parents ' bodies and kept there until they hatch . EOS
SOS the combination of hermaphroditism and early reproduction enables small populations to grow at an explosive rate . EOS
SOS some are simultaneous hermaphrodites , which can produce both eggs and sperm at the same time . EOS

SOS the exceptions are the beroids , whose young are miniature beroids with large mouths and no tentacles , and the platyctenids , whose young live as cydippid-like plankton until they reach UNK size , but then sink to the bottom and rapidly metamorphose into the adult form . EOS

SOS ctenophores form an animal phylum that is more complex than sponges , about as complex as cnidarians -lrb- jellyfish , sea anemones , etc . -rrb- , and less complex than bilaterians -lrb- which include almost all other animals -rrb- . EOS
SOS like sponges and cnidarians , ctenophores have two main layers of cells that sandwich a middle layer of jelly-like material , which is called the mesoglea in cnidarians and ctenophores ; more complex animals have three main cell layers and no intermediate jelly-like layer . EOS
SOS hence ctenophores and cnidarians have traditionally been labelled diploblastic , along with sponges . EOS

SOS hence ctenophores and cnidarians have traditionally been labelled diploblastic , along with sponges . EOS
SOS ranging from about 1 millimeter -lrb- UNK in -rrb- to 1.5 meters -lrb- 4.9 ft -rrb- in size , ctenophores are the largest UNK animals that use cilia -lrb- " hairs " -rrb- as their main method of locomotion . EOS
SOS ranging from about 1 millimeter -lrb- UNK in -rrb- to 1.5 meters -lrb- 4.9 ft -rrb- in size , ctenophores are the largest UNK animals that use cilia -lrb- " hairs " -rrb- as their main method of locomotion . EOS
SOS most species have eight strips , called comb rows , that run the length of their bodies and bear UNK bands of cilia , called " ctenes , " stacked along the comb rows so that when the cilia beat , those of each comb touch the comb below . EOS

SOS at least two textbooks base their descriptions of ctenophores on the cydippid pleurobrachia . EOS

SOS the outer surface bears usually eight comb rows , called UNK , which are used for swimming . EOS
SOS the " combs " -lrb- also called " ctenes " or " comb plates " -rrb- run across each row , and each consists of thousands of unusually long cilia , up to 2 millimeters -lrb- UNK in -rrb- . EOS
SOS unlike conventional cilia and flagella , which has a filament structure arranged in a 9 + 2 pattern , these cilia are arranged in a 9 + 3 pattern , where the extra compact filament is suspected to have a supporting function . EOS
SOS hence ctenophores usually swim in the direction in which the mouth is pointing , unlike jellyfish . EOS

SOS colloblasts are specialized UNK cells in the outer layer of the epidermis , and have three main components : a domed head with vesicles -lrb- chambers -rrb- that contain adhesive ; a stalk that anchors the cell in the lower layer of the epidermis or in the mesoglea ; and a spiral thread that coils round the stalk and is attached to the head and to the root of the stalk . SOS the tentilla of euplokamis differ significantly from those of other cydippids : they contain UNK muscle , a cell type otherwise unknown in the phylum ctenophora ; and they are coiled when relaxed , while the tentilla of all other known ctenophores UNK when relaxed . EOS

SOS the UNK " cydippid " UNK feeds exclusively on UNK , close relatives of UNK that form large UNK floating colonies , and juveniles of UNK attach themselves like parasites to UNK that are too large for them to UNK . EOS
SOS ctenophores used to be regarded as " dead ends " in marine food chains because it was thought their low ratio of organic matter to salt and water made them a poor diet for other animals . EOS
SOS detailed investigation of UNK salmon , UNK keta , showed that these fish digest ctenophores 20 times as fast as an equal weight of UNK , and that ctenophores can provide a good diet if there are enough of them around . EOS

SOS some jellyfish and turtles eat large quantities of ctenophores , and jellyfish may temporarily wipe out ctenophore populations . EOS
SOS on the other hand , in the late 1980s the western atlantic ctenophore mnemiopsis leidyi was accidentally introduced into the black sea and sea of azov via the ballast tanks of ships , and has been blamed for causing sharp drops in fish catches by eating both fish larvae and small crustaceans that would otherwise feed the adult fish . SOS several more recent studies comparing complete sequenced genomes of ctenophores with other sequenced animal genomes have also supported ctenophores as the sister lineage to all other animals . EOS
SOS however , other researchers have argued that the placement of ctenophora as sister to all other animals is a statistical anomaly caused by the high rate of evolution in ctenophore genomes , and that porifera -lrb- sponges -rrb- is the UNK animal phylum instead . EOS
SOS since all modern ctenophores except the beroids have cydippid-like larvae , it has widely been assumed that their last common ancestor also resembled cydippids , having an egg-shaped body and a pair of retractable tentacles . EOS
SOS a molecular phylogeny analysis in 2001 , using 26 species , including 4 recently discovered ones , confirmed that the cydippids are not monophyletic and concluded that the last common ancestor of modern ctenophores was cydippid-like . EOS
SOS this suggests that the last common ancestor of modern ctenophores was relatively recent , and perhaps was lucky enough to survive the cretaceous -- paleogene extinction event 65.5 million years ago while other lineages perished . EOS
SOS richard UNK 's purely morphological analysis in 1985 concluded that the cydippids are not monophyletic , in other words do not contain all and only the descendants of a single common ancestor that was itself a cydippid . EOS
SOS fresno -lrb- / UNK / UNK -rrb- , the county seat of fresno county , is a city in the u.s. state of california . EOS
SOS it is approximately 220 miles -lrb- 350 km -rrb- northwest of los angeles , 170 miles -lrb- 270 km -rrb- south of the state capital , sacramento , or 185 miles -lrb- 300 km -rrb- south of san francisco . EOS

SOS fresno -lrb- / UNK / UNK -rrb- , the county seat of fresno county , is a city in the u.s. state of california . EOS
SOS in 1872 , the central pacific railroad established a station near UNK 's -- by now a UNK productive wheat farm -- for its new southern pacific line . EOS
SOS many UNK residents , drawn by the convenience of the railroad and worried about flooding , moved to the new community . EOS
SOS fresno became an incorporated city in 1885 . EOS
SOS by 1931 the fresno traction company operated 47 streetcars over 49 miles of track . EOS
SOS soon there was a store around the station and the store grew the town of fresno station , later called fresno . EOS

SOS the popular neighborhood known as the tower district is centered around the historic tower theatre , which is included on the national list of historic places . EOS
SOS the theater was built in 1939 and is at olive and wishon avenues in the heart of the tower district . EOS
SOS -lrb- the name of the theater refers to a well-known landmark water tower , which is actually in another nearby area -rrb- . EOS
SOS to some extent , the businesses of the tower district were developed due to the proximity of the original fresno normal school , -lrb- later renamed california state university at fresno -rrb- . EOS
SOS in 1916 the college moved to what is now the site of fresno city college one-half mile north of the tower district . EOS

SOS the alta vista tract , as the land would become known , was mapped by william UNK for the pacific improvement corporation , and was officially UNK in 1911 . EOS
SOS in 1914 developers billings & UNK acquired the tract , completed street development , provided the last of the necessary municipal improvements including water service , and began marketing the property with fervor . EOS
SOS a mere half decade later the tract had 267 homes . EOS
SOS this rapid development was no doubt hastened by the fresno traction company right-of-way along huntington boulevard , which provided streetcar connections between downtown and the county hospital . EOS
SOS the " west side " of fresno , also often called " southwest fresno " , is one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city . EOS
SOS the neighborhood lies southwest of the 99 freeway -lrb- which divides it from downtown fresno -rrb- , west of the 41 freeway and south of nielsen ave -lrb- or the newly constructed 180 freeway -rrb- , and extends to the city limits to the west and south . EOS
SOS the neighborhood is traditionally considered to be the center of fresno 's african-american community . EOS
SOS it is culturally diverse and also includes significant mexican-american and asian-american -lrb- principally hmong or laotian -rrb- populations . EOS
SOS the " west side " of fresno , also often called " southwest fresno " , is one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city . EOS
SOS the neighborhood includes kearney boulevard , named after early 20th century entrepreneur and millionaire m. theo kearney , which extends from fresno street in southwest fresno about 20 mi -lrb- 32 km -rrb- west to UNK , california . EOS
SOS a small , UNK rural road for most of its length , kearney boulevard is lined with tall palm trees . EOS
SOS the roughly half-mile stretch of kearney boulevard between fresno street and thorne ave was at one time the preferred neighborhood for fresno 's elite african-american families . EOS
SOS another section , brookhaven , on the southern edge of the west side south of jensen and west of elm , was given the name by the fresno city council in an effort to revitalize the neighborhood 's image . EOS
SOS the isolated subdivision was for years known as the " UNK pound " in reference to a local gang , and as of late 2008 was still known for high levels of violent crime . EOS
SOS while many homes in the neighborhood date back to the 1930s or before , the neighborhood is also home to several public housing developments built between the 1960s and 1990s by the fresno housing authority . EOS
SOS there have been numerous attempts to revitalize the neighborhood , including the construction of a modern shopping center on the corner of fresno and b streets , an aborted attempt to build luxury homes and a golf course on the western edge of the neighborhood , and some new section 8 apartments have been built along church ave west of elm st. UNK meat solutions and foster farms both have large processing facilities in the neighborhood , and the stench from these -lrb- and other small industrial facilities -rrb- has long plagued area residents . SOS fresno is the largest u.s. city not directly linked to an interstate highway . EOS

SOS starting in the late 1950s , american computer scientist paul baran developed the concept distributed adaptive message block switching with the goal to provide a fault-tolerant , efficient routing method for telecommunication messages as part of a research program at the rand corporation , funded by the us department of defense . EOS
SOS this concept contrasted and contradicted the UNK established principles of UNK of network bandwidth , largely fortified by the development of telecommunications in the bell system . EOS
SOS davies is credited with coining the modern name packet switching and inspiring numerous packet switching networks in europe in the decade following , including the incorporation of the concept in the early arpanet in the united states . EOS

SOS starting in the late 1950s , american computer scientist paul baran developed the concept distributed adaptive message block switching with the goal to provide a fault-tolerant , efficient routing method for telecommunication messages as part of a research program at the rand corporation , funded by the us department of defense . EOS
SOS davies is credited with coining the modern name packet switching and inspiring numerous packet switching networks in europe in the decade following , including the incorporation of the concept in the early arpanet in the united states . EOS
SOS packet switching contrasts with another principal networking paradigm , circuit switching , a method which pre-allocates dedicated network bandwidth specifically for each communication session , each having a constant bit rate and latency between nodes . EOS
SOS in cases of billable services , such as cellular communication services , circuit switching is characterized by a fee per unit of connection time , even when no data is transferred , while packet switching may be characterized by a fee per unit of information transmitted , such as characters , packets , or messages . EOS

SOS in case of a shared physical medium -lrb- such as radio or UNK -rrb- , the packets may be delivered according to a multiple access scheme . EOS

SOS baran developed the concept of distributed adaptive message block switching during his research at the rand corporation for the us air force into survivable communications networks , first presented to the air force in the summer of 1961 as briefing b-265 , later published as rand report p-2626 in 1962 , and finally in report rm 3420 in 1964 . EOS
SOS baran developed the concept of distributed adaptive message block switching during his research at the rand corporation for the us air force into survivable communications networks , first presented to the air force in the summer of 1961 as briefing b-265 , later published as rand report p-2626 in 1962 , and finally in report rm 3420 in 1964 . EOS
SOS the work focuses on three key ideas : use of a decentralized network with multiple paths between any two points , dividing user messages into message blocks , later called packets , and delivery of these messages by store and forward switching . EOS

SOS starting in 1965 , donald davies at the national physical laboratory , uk , independently developed the same message routing methodology as developed by baran . EOS
SOS he called it packet switching , a more accessible name than baran 's , and proposed to build a nationwide network in the uk . EOS

SOS in UNK mode each packet includes complete addressing information . EOS
SOS the packets are routed individually , sometimes resulting in different paths and UNK delivery . EOS
SOS each packet is labeled with a destination address , source address , and port numbers . EOS
SOS at the destination , the original UNK is reassembled in the correct order , based on the packet sequence number . EOS
SOS the packet header can be small , as it only needs to contain this code and any information , such as length , timestamp , or sequence number , which is different for different packets . EOS
SOS routing a packet requires the node to look up the connection id in a table . EOS
SOS the packets include a connection identifier rather than address information and are negotiated between endpoints so that they are delivered in order and with error checking . EOS

SOS for a while , frame relay was used to interconnect UNK across wide area networks . EOS
SOS a typical configuration is to run ip over atm or a version of mpls . EOS

SOS UNK was an international data communications network headquartered in san jose , ca that utilized virtual call packet switched technology and used x . 25 , sna/sdlc , bsc and ascii interfaces to connect host computers -lrb- servers -rrb- at thousands of large companies , educational institutions , and government agencies . SOS the private networks were often connected via gateways to the public network to reach locations not on the private network . EOS
SOS there were two kinds of x . 25 networks . EOS

SOS the black death is thought to have originated in the arid plains of central asia , where it then travelled along the silk road , reaching crimea by 1343 . EOS
SOS from there , it was most likely carried by oriental rat fleas living on the black rats that were regular passengers on merchant ships . EOS
SOS spreading throughout the mediterranean and europe , the black death is estimated to have killed 30 -- 60 % of europe 's total population . EOS
SOS the world population as a whole did not recover to UNK levels until the 17th century . EOS
SOS the plague UNK occasionally in europe until the 19th century . EOS
SOS the plague disease , caused by yersinia pestis , is UNK -lrb- commonly present -rrb- in populations of fleas carried by ground rodents , including marmots , in various areas including central asia , UNK , western asia , northern india and uganda . EOS
SOS nestorian graves dating to 1338 -- 39 near lake UNK UNK in kyrgyzstan have inscriptions referring to plague and are thought by many UNK to mark the outbreak of the epidemic , from which it could easily have spread to china and india . EOS
SOS in october 2010 , medical geneticists suggested that all three of the great waves of the plague originated in china . EOS
SOS in the 1330s a large number of natural disasters and UNK led to widespread famine , starting in 1331 , with a deadly plague arriving soon after . EOS

SOS other arguments include the lack of accounts of the death of rats before outbreaks of plague between the 14th and 17th centuries ; temperatures that are too cold in northern europe for the survival of fleas ; that , despite primitive transport systems , the spread of the black death was much faster than that of modern bubonic plague ; that mortality rates of the black death appear to be very high ; that , while modern bubonic plague is largely endemic as a rural disease , the black death indiscriminately struck urban and rural areas ; and that the pattern of the black death , with major outbreaks in the same areas separated by 5 to 15 years , differs from modern bubonic plague -- which often becomes endemic for decades with annual flare-ups . SOS UNK ridges , high regions on the seafloor where hydrothermal vents and volcanoes exist , were explained as divergent boundaries , where two plates move apart . EOS
SOS arcs of volcanoes and earthquakes were explained as convergent boundaries , where one plate UNK under another . EOS
SOS transform boundaries , such as the san andreas fault system , resulted in widespread powerful earthquakes . EOS

SOS the principle of UNK relationships pertains to the formation of faults and the age of the sequences through which they cut . EOS
SOS faults are younger than the rocks they cut ; accordingly , if a fault is found that penetrates some formations but not those on top of it , then the formations that were cut are older than the fault , and the ones that are not cut must be younger than the fault . EOS
SOS finding the key bed in these situations may help determine whether the fault is a normal fault or a thrust fault . EOS

SOS as a result , UNK are older than the rock which contains them . EOS

SOS the principle of faunal succession is based on the appearance of fossils in sedimentary rocks . EOS
SOS based on principles laid out by william smith almost a hundred years before the publication of charles darwin 's theory of evolution , the principles of succession were developed independently of evolutionary thought . EOS

SOS at the beginning of the 20th century , important advancement in geological science was facilitated by the ability to obtain accurate absolute dates to geologic events using radioactive isotopes and other methods . EOS
SOS previously , geologists could only use fossils and stratigraphic correlation to date sections of rock relative to one another . EOS
SOS with isotopic dates it became possible to assign absolute ages to rock units , and these absolute dates could be applied to fossil sequences in which there was datable material , converting the old relative ages into new absolute ages . EOS

SOS when rock units are placed under horizontal compression , they shorten and become thicker . EOS
SOS in the shallow crust , where brittle deformation can occur , thrust faults form , which cause deeper rock to move on top of shallower rock . EOS
SOS these folds can either be those where the material in the center of the fold buckles upwards , creating " UNK " , or where it buckles downwards , creating " UNK " . EOS

SOS if the tops of the rock units within the folds remain pointing upwards , they are called UNK and UNK , respectively . EOS
SOS extension causes the rock units as a whole to become longer and thinner . EOS
SOS these stretched rocks can also pinch into lenses , known as UNK , after the french word for " sausage " , because of their visual similarity . EOS
SOS stretching of units can result in their UNK ; in fact , there is a location within the maria fold and thrust belt in which the entire sedimentary sequence of the grand canyon can be seen over a length of less than a meter . EOS
SOS rocks at the depth to be UNK stretched are often also metamorphosed . EOS

SOS continual motion along the fault maintains the topographic gradient in spite of the movement of sediment , and continues to create accommodation space for the material to deposit . EOS

SOS in an optical mineralogy analysis , thin sections of rock samples are analyzed through a UNK microscope , where the minerals can be identified through their different properties in UNK and UNK light , including their UNK , UNK , twinning , and interference properties with a UNK lens . EOS
SOS petrologists can also use fluid inclusion data and perform high temperature and pressure physical experiments to understand the temperatures and pressures at which different mineral phases appear , and how they change through igneous and metamorphic processes . EOS
SOS petrologists can also use fluid inclusion data and perform high temperature and pressure physical experiments to understand the temperatures and pressures at which different mineral phases appear , and how they change through igneous and metamorphic processes . EOS
SOS this research can be extrapolated to the field to understand metamorphic processes and the conditions of UNK of igneous rocks . EOS
SOS structural geologists use microscopic analysis of oriented thin sections of geologic samples to observe the fabric within the rocks which gives information about strain within the crystalline structure of the rocks . EOS
SOS structural geologists use microscopic analysis of oriented thin sections of geologic samples to observe the fabric within the rocks which gives information about strain within the crystalline structure of the rocks . EOS
SOS they also plot and combine measurements of geological structures in order to better understand the orientations of faults and folds in order to reconstruct the history of rock deformation in the area . EOS
SOS in addition , they perform analog and numerical experiments of rock deformation in large and small settings . EOS
SOS among the most well-known experiments in structural geology are those involving orogenic wedges , which are zones in which mountains are built along convergent tectonic plate boundaries . EOS
SOS among the most well-known experiments in structural geology are those involving orogenic wedges , which are zones in which mountains are built along convergent tectonic plate boundaries . EOS
SOS in the analog versions of these experiments , horizontal layers of sand are pulled along a lower surface into a back stop , which results in UNK patterns of faulting and the growth of a critically tapered -lrb- all angles remain the same -rrb- orogenic wedge . EOS
SOS in the analog versions of these experiments , horizontal layers of sand are pulled along a lower surface into a back stop , which results in UNK patterns of faulting and the growth of a critically tapered -lrb- all angles remain the same -rrb- orogenic wedge . EOS
SOS numerical models work in the same way as these analog models , though they are often more sophisticated and can include patterns of erosion and uplift in the mountain belt . EOS
SOS in the laboratory , stratigraphers analyze samples of stratigraphic sections that can be returned from the field , such as those from drill cores . EOS
SOS stratigraphers also analyze data from geophysical surveys that show the locations of stratigraphic units in the subsurface . EOS
SOS geophysical data and well logs can be combined to produce a better view of the subsurface , and stratigraphers often use computer programs to do this in three dimensions . EOS
SOS geophysical data and well logs can be combined to produce a better view of the subsurface , and stratigraphers often use computer programs to do this in three dimensions . EOS
SOS stratigraphers can then use these data to reconstruct ancient processes occurring on the surface of the earth , interpret past environments , and locate areas for water , coal , and hydrocarbon extraction . EOS
SOS UNK precisely date rocks within the stratigraphic section in order to provide better absolute bounds on the timing and rates of deposition . EOS
SOS in the laboratory , UNK analyze rock samples from UNK and drill cores for the fossils found in them . EOS
SOS magnetic stratigraphers look for signs of magnetic reversals in igneous rock units within the drill cores . EOS
SOS UNK precisely date rocks within the stratigraphic section in order to provide better absolute bounds on the timing and rates of deposition . EOS
SOS some modern scholars , such as fielding h. garrison , are of the opinion that the origin of the science of geology can be traced to persia after the muslim conquests had come to an end . EOS
SOS abu UNK al-biruni -lrb- 973 -- UNK ce -rrb- was one of the earliest persian geologists , whose works included the earliest writings on the geology of india , hypothesizing that the indian subcontinent was once a sea . EOS
SOS in china , the polymath shen kuo -lrb- 1031 -- 1095 -rrb- formulated a hypothesis for the process of land formation : based on his observation of fossil animal shells in a geological stratum in a mountain hundreds of miles from the ocean , he inferred that the land was formed by erosion of the mountains and by deposition of silt . EOS
SOS drawing from greek and indian scientific literature that were not destroyed by the muslim conquests , the persian scholar ibn sina -lrb- avicenna , UNK -- 1037 -rrb- proposed detailed explanations for the formation of mountains , the origin of earthquakes , and other topics central to modern geology , which provided an essential foundation for the later development of the science . EOS
SOS in china , the polymath shen kuo -lrb- 1031 -- 1095 -rrb- formulated a hypothesis for the process of land formation : based on his observation of fossil animal shells in a geological stratum in a mountain hundreds of miles from the ocean , he inferred that the land was formed by erosion of the mountains and by deposition of silt . SOS james hutton is often viewed as the first modern geologist . EOS
SOS in 1785 he presented a paper entitled theory of the earth to the royal society of edinburgh . EOS
SOS hutton published a two-volume version of his ideas in 1795 -lrb- vol . EOS
SOS in his paper , he explained his theory that the earth must be much older than had previously been supposed in order to allow enough time for mountains to be eroded and for sediments to form new rocks at the bottom of the sea , which in turn were raised up to become dry land . EOS
SOS the first geological map of the u.s. was produced in 1809 by william maclure . EOS
SOS the first geological map of the u.s. was produced in 1809 by william maclure . EOS
SOS in 1807 , maclure commenced the self-imposed task of making a geological survey of the united states . EOS

SOS newcastle upon tyne -lrb- rp : i / UNK pn tan / ; locally : UNK UNK pn tan / -rrb- , commonly known as newcastle , is a city in tyne and wear , north east england , 103 miles -lrb- 166 km -rrb- south of edinburgh and 277 miles -lrb- 446 km -rrb- north of london on the northern bank of the river tyne , 8.5 mi -lrb- 13.7 km -rrb- from the north sea . SOS newcastle upon tyne -lrb- rp : i / UNK pn tan / ; locally : UNK UNK pn tan / -rrb- , commonly known as newcastle , is a city in tyne and wear , north east england , 103 miles -lrb- 166 km -rrb- south of edinburgh and 277 miles -lrb- 446 km -rrb- north of london on the northern bank of the river tyne , 8.5 mi -lrb- 13.7 km -rrb- from the north sea . EOS
SOS newcastle is a member of the english core cities group and is a member of the UNK network of european cities . EOS
SOS newcastle was part of the county of northumberland until 1400 , when it became a county itself , a status it retained until becoming part of tyne and wear in 1974 . EOS
SOS -lsb- not in citation given -rsb- the regional nickname and dialect for people from newcastle and the surrounding area is geordie . EOS
SOS the city developed around the roman settlement pons aelius and was named after the castle built in 1080 by robert UNK , william the conqueror 's eldest son . EOS
SOS the city grew as an important centre for the wool trade in the 14th century , and later became a major coal mining area . EOS
SOS the city grew as an important centre for the wool trade in the 14th century , and later became a major coal mining area . EOS
SOS the port developed in the 16th century and , along with the UNK lower down the river tyne , was amongst the world 's largest shipbuilding and UNK centres . EOS
SOS it has hosted the world 's most popular half marathon , the great north run , since it began in 1981 . EOS
SOS the first recorded settlement in what is now newcastle was pons aelius , a roman fort and bridge across the river tyne . EOS
SOS the first recorded settlement in what is now newcastle was pons aelius , a roman fort and bridge across the river tyne . EOS
SOS the population of pons aelius at this period was estimated at 2,000 . EOS
SOS fragments of hadrian 's wall are still visible in parts of newcastle , particularly along the west road . EOS
SOS the extent of hadrian 's wall was 73 miles -lrb- 117 km -rrb- , spanning the width of britain ; the wall incorporated the UNK , a large UNK ditch with parallel mounds , and was constructed primarily for defence , to prevent unwanted immigration and the incursion of pictish tribes from the north , not as a fighting line for a major invasion . EOS
SOS throughout the middle ages , newcastle was england 's northern fortress . EOS
SOS incorporated first by henry ii , the city had a new charter granted by elizabeth in 1589 . EOS
SOS a UNK -lrb- 7.6 m -rrb- high stone wall was built around the town in the 13th century , to defend it from invaders during the border war against scotland . EOS
SOS the scots king william the lion was imprisoned in newcastle in 1174 , and edward i brought the stone of scone and william wallace south through the town . EOS
SOS newcastle was successfully defended against the scots three times during the 14th century , and was created a county corporate with its own sheriff by henry iv in 1400 . EOS

SOS in the 18th century american timothy dexter , an entrepreneur , widely regarded as an UNK , defied this idiom . EOS
SOS he was persuaded to sail a shipment of coal to newcastle by merchants plotting to ruin him ; however his shipment arrived on the tyne during a strike that had crippled local production ; unexpectedly he made a considerable profit . EOS
SOS in the UNK area , to the east of the city and beside the river , resided the UNK community of UNK and their families . EOS
SOS they were so called because they worked on the UNK , boats that were used to transfer coal from the river banks to the waiting UNK , for export to london and elsewhere . EOS

SOS in 1644 the city was then besieged for many months and was eventually stormed -lrb- ` with roaring UNK ' -rrb- and sacked by cromwell 's allies . EOS

SOS this revolution resulted in the urbanization of the city . EOS
SOS in 1817 the UNK company , at one time the largest pottery company in the world , moved to the city . EOS
SOS newcastle was one of the first cities in the world to be lit up by electric lighting . EOS
SOS in the 19th century , shipbuilding and heavy engineering were central to the city 's prosperity ; and the city was a powerhouse of the industrial revolution . EOS
SOS innovations in newcastle and surrounding areas included the development of safety lamps , stephenson 's rocket , lord armstrong 's artillery , UNK flour , joseph swan 's electric light bulbs , and charles parsons ' invention of the steam turbine , which led to the revolution of marine propulsion and the production of cheap electricity . SOS in large parts , newcastle still retains a medieval street layout . EOS
SOS narrow alleys or ` UNK ' , most of which can only be traversed by foot , still exist in abundance , particularly around the riverside . EOS

SOS the historic heart of newcastle is the grainger town area . EOS
SOS established on classical streets built by richard grainger , a builder and developer , between 1835 and 1842 , some of newcastle upon tyne 's finest buildings and streets lie within this area of the city centre including grainger market , theatre royal , grey street , grainger street and clayton street . EOS
SOS these buildings are predominantly four stories high , with vertical UNK , domes , UNK and spikes . EOS
SOS of grainger town 's 450 buildings , 244 are listed , of which 29 are grade i and 49 are grade ii * . EOS
SOS the grainger market replaced an earlier market originally built in 1808 called the butcher market . EOS
SOS the grainger market itself , was opened in 1835 and was newcastle 's first indoor market . EOS

SOS the climate in newcastle is oceanic -lrb- kppen cfb -rrb- and significantly milder than some other locations in the world at a similar latitude , due to the warming influence of the gulf stream -lrb- via the north atlantic drift -rrb- . EOS
SOS the climate in newcastle is oceanic -lrb- kppen cfb -rrb- and significantly milder than some other locations in the world at a similar latitude , due to the warming influence of the gulf stream -lrb- via the north atlantic drift -rrb- . EOS
SOS being in the rain shadow of the north UNK , it is among the driest cities in the uk . EOS
SOS temperature extremes recorded at newcastle weather centre include UNK c -lrb- UNK f -rrb- during august 1990 down to 12.6 c -lrb- 9.3 f -rrb- during january 1982 . EOS
SOS in contrast to other areas influenced by the gulf stream , such as inland scandinavia , newcastle has milder winters and cooler summers , similar to the remainder of the british isles . EOS

SOS tyneside flats were built as terraces , one of each pair of doors led to an UNK flat while the other led into the UNK flat , each of two or three rooms . EOS

SOS the dialect of newcastle is known as geordie , and contains a large amount of vocabulary and distinctive word pronunciations not used in other parts of the united kingdom . EOS
SOS the geordie dialect has much of its origins in the language spoken by the anglo-saxon populations who migrated to and conquered much of england after the end of roman imperial rule . EOS
SOS this language was the forerunner of modern english ; but while the dialects of other english regions have been heavily altered by the influences of other foreign languages -- particularly latin and norman french -- the geordie dialect retains many elements of the old language . EOS
SOS an example of this is the pronunciation of certain words : " dead " , " cow " , " house " and " strong " are pronounced " deed " , " UNK " , " UNK " and " UNK " -- which is how they were pronounced in the anglo-saxon language . EOS
SOS other geordie words with anglo-saxon origins include : " UNK " -lrb- from the anglo-saxon " UNK " , meaning " teach " -rrb- , " burn " -lrb- " stream " -rrb- and " gan " -lrb- " go " -rrb- . EOS
SOS " UNK " and " UNK " , meaning " child " and " home " , respectively , are examples of geordie words with origins in scandinavia ; UNK and UNK are the corresponding modern norwegian and danish words . EOS
SOS some words used in the geordie dialect are used elsewhere in the northern united kingdom . EOS
SOS the words " bonny " -lrb- meaning " pretty " -rrb- , " UNK " -lrb- " come on " -rrb- , " UNK " -lrb- " bounce " -rrb- and " UNK " -lrb- " go away " or " you 're UNK " -rrb- , all appear to be used in scots ; " UNK " -lrb- " yes " -rrb- and " UNK " -lrb- ipa : / / nat / , UNK with out , " nothing " -rrb- are used elsewhere in northern england . EOS
SOS many words , however , appear to be used exclusively in newcastle and the surrounding area , such as " UNK " -lrb- a versatile word meaning " good " , " nice " or " very " -rrb- , " UNK " -lrb- " dirty " -rrb- , " UNK " -lrb- " toilet " -rrb- , " hoy " -lrb- " throw " , from the dutch UNK , via west frisian -rrb- , " hockle " -lrb- " spit " -rrb- . EOS
SOS many words , however , appear to be used exclusively in newcastle and the surrounding area , such as " UNK " -lrb- a versatile word meaning " good " , " nice " or " very " -rrb- , " UNK " -lrb- " dirty " -rrb- , " UNK " -lrb- " toilet " -rrb- , " hoy " -lrb- " throw " , from the dutch UNK , via west frisian -rrb- , " hockle " -lrb- " spit " -rrb- . SOS in a report , published in early february 2007 by the ear institute at the university college london , and widex , a danish hearing aid manufacturer , newcastle was named as the noisiest city in the whole of the uk , with an average level of 80.4 decibels . EOS
SOS in a report , published in early february 2007 by the ear institute at the university college london , and widex , a danish hearing aid manufacturer , newcastle was named as the noisiest city in the whole of the uk , with an average level of 80.4 decibels . EOS
SOS in a report , published in early february 2007 by the ear institute at the university college london , and widex , a danish hearing aid manufacturer , newcastle was named as the noisiest city in the whole of the uk , with an average level of 80.4 decibels . EOS
SOS the report claimed that these noise levels would have a negative long-term impact on the health of the city 's residents . EOS
SOS the report was criticized , however , for attaching too much weight to readings at arbitrarily selected locations , which in newcastle 's case included a motorway UNK without pedestrian access . EOS

SOS the city has a proud history of theatre . EOS
SOS stephen kemble of the famous kemble family successfully managed the original theatre royal , newcastle for fifteen years -lrb- 1791 -- 1806 -rrb- . EOS
SOS stephen kemble guided the theatre through many celebrated seasons . EOS
SOS the original theatre royal in newcastle was opened on 21 january 1788 and was located on UNK street . EOS
SOS it was demolished to make way for grey street , where its replacement was built . EOS
SOS the city still contains many theatres . EOS
SOS the largest , the theatre royal on grey street , first opened in 1837 , designed by john and benjamin green . EOS

SOS the mill volvo tyne theatre hosts smaller touring productions , whilst other venues feature local talent . EOS

SOS the literary and philosophical society of newcastle upon tyne -lrb- popularly known as the ` lit & phil ' -rrb- is the largest independent library outside london , housing more than 150,000 books . EOS
SOS its music library contains 8000 cds and 10,000 lps . EOS
SOS operating since 1793 and founded as a ` conversation club , ' its lecture theatre was the first public building to be lit by electric light , during a lecture by joseph swan on 20 october 1880 . EOS

SOS newcastle UNK , held on the late august bank holiday weekend , is an annual two-day multicultural event , blending drama , music and food from punjabi , pakistani , bengali and hindu cultures . EOS
SOS the 2009 event will be in the norman foster designed sage gateshead music and arts centre in september . EOS

SOS newcastle international airport is located approximately 6 miles -lrb- 9.7 km -rrb- from the city centre on the northern outskirts of the city near UNK and is the larger of the two main airports serving the north east . EOS
SOS it is connected to the city via the metro light rail system and a journey into newcastle city centre takes approximately 20 minutes . EOS

SOS the airport handles over five million passengers per year , and is the tenth largest , and the fastest growing regional airport in the uk , expecting to reach 10 million passengers by 2016 , and 15 million by 2030 . EOS
SOS as of 2007 -lsb- update -rsb- , over 90 destinations are available worldwide . EOS
SOS glazing was placed over the historic arches and the victorian architecture was enhanced ; transforming the 19th century public portico . EOS
SOS the station is one of only six grade one listed railway stations in the uk . EOS
SOS opened in 1850 by queen victoria , it was the first covered railway station in the world and was much copied across the uk . EOS
SOS it has a neoclassical faade , originally designed by the architect john UNK , and was constructed in collaboration with robert stephenson . EOS
SOS the city 's other mainline station , manors , is to the east of the city centre . EOS

SOS the city is served by the tyne and wear metro , a system of suburban and underground railways covering much of tyne and wear . EOS
SOS it was opened in five phases between 1980 and 1984 , and was britain 's first urban light rail transit system ; two extensions were opened in 1991 and 2002 . EOS
SOS it was developed from a combination of existing and newly built tracks and stations , with UNK tunnels constructed through newcastle city centre . EOS
SOS a bridge was built across the tyne , between newcastle and gateshead , and opened by queen elizabeth ii in 1981 . EOS
SOS the network is operated by db UNK on behalf of nexus and carries over 37 million passengers a year , extending as far as newcastle airport , tynemouth , south shields and south UNK in sunderland . EOS
SOS the system is currently undergoing a period of refurbishment and modernization , entitled ` metro : all change . ' EOS
SOS the programme has replaced all ticket machines and introduced ticket gates at the busiest stations - part of the transition to smart UNK . EOS
SOS in addition ; tracks , signalling and overhead wires are also being overhauled . EOS
SOS longer term plans include the procurement of an entirely new fleet of trains and further extensions to the system . EOS
SOS several of the proposed routes would require trams as opposed to the current light rail trains . EOS
SOS major roads in the area include the a1 -lrb- gateshead newcastle western bypass -rrb- , stretching north to edinburgh and south to london ; the a19 heading south past sunderland and middlesbrough to york and doncaster ; the a69 heading west to carlisle ; the a696 , which becomes the a68 heads past newcastle airport and up through central northumberland and central scottish borders , the a167 , the old " great north road " , heading south to gateshead , chester-le-street , durham and darlington ; and the a1058 " coast road " , which runs from jesmond to the east coast between tynemouth and cullercoats . SOS following guidelines set in the national cycling strategy , newcastle first developed its cycling strategy in 1998 . EOS
SOS as of 2012 , the local council social aims and objectives for cycling include : highlighting the usage of cycling to cut city congestion ; educating that cycling promotes healthy living ... the authority also has infrastructure aims and objectives which include : developing on road cycle networks on quieter streets ; making safer routes on busier streets ; innovating and implementing contraflows on one way streets ; developing the existing off road cycle route networks and improve signage ; joining up routes that are partially or completely isolated ; increase the number of cycle parking facilities ; working with employers to integrate cycling into workplace travel plans ; link the local networks to national networks . EOS

SOS the city has two universities -- newcastle university and northumbria university . EOS
SOS newcastle university has its origins in the school of medicine and surgery , established in 1834 and became independent from durham university on 1 august 1963 to form the university of newcastle upon tyne . EOS
SOS it won the coveted sunday times university of the year award in 2000 . EOS
SOS northumbria university has its origins in the newcastle polytechnic , established in 1969 and became the university of northumbria at newcastle in 1992 as part of the UNK process in which polytechnics became new universities . EOS
SOS northumbria university was voted ` best new university ' by the times good university guide 2005 and also won a much coveted company award of the " most it enabled organisation " -lrb- in the uk -rrb- , by the it industry magazine computing . EOS

SOS the v & a is located in the brompton district of the royal borough of kensington and chelsea , in an area that has become known as " albertopolis " because of its association with prince albert , the albert memorial and the major cultural institutions with which he was associated . EOS
SOS the victoria and albert museum -lrb- often abbreviated as the v & a -rrb- , london , is the world 's largest museum of decorative arts and design , housing a permanent collection of over 4.5 million objects . EOS
SOS it was founded in 1852 and named after queen victoria and prince albert . EOS

SOS the v & a is located in the brompton district of the royal borough of kensington and chelsea , in an area that has become known as " albertopolis " because of its association with prince albert , the albert memorial and the major cultural institutions with which he was associated . EOS
SOS it was founded in 1852 and named after queen victoria and prince albert . EOS
SOS it was founded in 1852 and named after queen victoria and prince albert . EOS
SOS the museum is a UNK public body sponsored by the department for culture , media and sport . EOS
SOS like other national british museums , entrance to the museum has been free since 2001 . EOS
SOS the v & a covers 12.5 acres -lrb- 51,000 m2 -rrb- and 145 galleries . EOS
SOS the v & a covers 12.5 acres -lrb- 51,000 m2 -rrb- and 145 galleries . EOS
SOS its collection spans 5,000 years of art , from ancient times to the present day , from the cultures of europe , north america , asia and north africa . EOS
SOS its collection spans 5,000 years of art , from ancient times to the present day , from the cultures of europe , north america , asia and north africa . EOS
SOS the museum owns the world 's largest collection of post-classical sculpture , with the holdings of italian renaissance items being the largest outside italy . EOS
SOS the v & a has its origins in the great exhibition of 1851 , with which henry cole , the museum 's first director , was involved in planning ; initially it was known as the museum of manufactures , first opening in may 1852 at marlborough house , but by september had been transferred to somerset house . SOS the v & a has its origins in the great exhibition of 1851 , with which henry cole , the museum 's first director , was involved in planning ; initially it was known as the museum of manufactures , first opening in may 1852 at marlborough house , but by september had been transferred to somerset house . EOS
SOS in 1855 the german architect gottfried UNK , at the request of cole , produced a design for the museum , but it was rejected by the board of trade as too expensive . EOS
SOS the official opening by queen victoria was on 22 june 1857 . EOS
SOS george wallis -lrb- 1811 -- 1891 -rrb- , the first keeper of fine art collection , passionately promoted the idea of wide art education through the museum collections . EOS
SOS in the following year , late night openings were introduced , made possible by the use of gas lighting . EOS
SOS this led to the transfer to the museum of the school of design that had been founded in 1837 at somerset house ; after the transfer it was referred to as the art school or art training school , later to become the royal college of art which finally achieved full independence in 1949 . EOS
SOS before the return of the collections after the war , the britain can make it exhibition was held between september and november 1946 , attracting nearly a million and a half visitors . EOS
SOS before the return of the collections after the war , the britain can make it exhibition was held between september and november 1946 , attracting nearly a million and a half visitors . EOS
SOS the success of this exhibition led to the planning of the festival of britain -lrb- 1951 -rrb- . EOS
SOS the success of this exhibition led to the planning of the festival of britain -lrb- 1951 -rrb- . EOS
SOS by 1948 most of the collections had been returned to the museum . EOS
SOS in july 1973 , as part of its outreach programme to young people , the v & a became the first museum in britain to present a rock concert . EOS
SOS the v & a presented a combined UNK by british progressive folk-rock band gryphon , who explored the lineage of mediaeval music and instrumentation and related how those contributed to contemporary music 500 years later . EOS
SOS this innovative approach to bringing young people to museums was a UNK of the UNK of roy strong and was subsequently emulated by some other british museums . EOS

SOS the v & a is in discussion with the university of dundee , university of UNK , dundee city council and the scottish government with a view to opening a new # 43 million gallery in dundee that would use the v & a brand although it would be funded through and operated independently . EOS
SOS as of 2015 , with costs estimated at # 76 million , it is the most expensive gallery project ever undertaken in scotland . EOS
SOS the v & a dundee will be on the city 's waterfront and is intended to focus on fashion , architecture , product design , graphic arts and photography . EOS
SOS the v & a dundee will be on the city 's waterfront and is intended to focus on fashion , architecture , product design , graphic arts and photography . EOS
SOS it is planned that it could open within five years . EOS
SOS the land was occupied by brompton park house , which was extended , most notably by the " brompton boilers " , which were starkly utilitarian iron galleries with a temporary look and were later dismantled and used to build the v & a museum of childhood . EOS
SOS the first building to be erected that still forms part of the museum was the sheepshanks gallery in 1857 on the eastern side of the garden . EOS
SOS on the very northern edge of the site is situated the secretariat wing , also built in 1862 this houses the offices and board room etc . and is not open to the public . EOS
SOS to the east of this were additional galleries , the decoration of which was the work of another designer owen jones , these were the oriental courts -lrb- covering india , china and japan -rrb- completed in 1863 , none of this decoration survives , part of these galleries became the new galleries covering the 19th century , opened in december 2006 . SOS the style adopted for this part of the museum was italian renaissance , much use was made of terracotta , brick and mosaic , this north faade was intended as the main entrance to the museum with its bronze doors designed by james gamble & reuben townroe having six panels depicting : humphry davy -lrb- chemistry -rrb- ; isaac newton -lrb- astronomy -rrb- ; james watt -lrb- mechanics -rrb- ; bramante -lrb- architecture -rrb- ; michelangelo -lrb- sculpture -rrb- ; titian -lrb- painting -rrb- ; thus representing the range of the museums collections , godfrey sykes also designed the terracotta embellishments and the mosaic in the pediment of the north faade commemorating the great exhibition the profits from which helped to fund the museum , this is flanked by terracotta statue groups by percival ball . SOS the lower part of the walls are UNK in wood with a band of paintings depicting fruit and the occasional figure , with moulded plaster foliage on the main part of the wall and a plaster UNK around the decorated ceiling and stained-glass windows by edward burne-jones . EOS
SOS the centre refreshment room 1865 -- 77 was designed in a renaissance style by james gamble , the walls and even the ionic columns are covered in decorative and moulded ceramic tile , the ceiling consists of elaborate designs on enamelled metal sheets and matching stained-glass windows , the marble fireplace was designed and sculpted by alfred stevens and was removed from dorchester house prior to that building 's demolition in 1929 . SOS scott also designed the two cast courts 1870 -- 73 to the southeast of the garden -lrb- the site of the " brompton boilers " -rrb- , these vast spaces have ceilings 70 feet -lrb- 21 m -rrb- in height to accommodate the plaster casts of parts of famous buildings , including trajan 's column -lrb- in two separate pieces -rrb- . SOS the final part of the museum designed by scott was the art library and what is now the sculpture gallery on the south side of the garden , built 1877 -- 83 , the exterior mosaic panels in the parapet were designed by reuben townroe who also designed the plaster work in the library , sir john taylor designed the book shelves and cases , also this was the first part of the museum to have electric lighting . SOS rodin is represented by more than 20 works in the museum collection , making it one of the largest collections of the sculptor 's work outside france ; these were given to the museum by the sculptor in 1914 , as acknowledgement of britain 's support of france in world war i , although the statue of st john the baptist had been purchased in 1902 by public subscription . SOS conservation is responsible for the long-term preservation of the collections , and covers all the collections held by the v & a and the v & a museum of childhood . EOS
SOS activities include controlling the museum environment -lrb- for example , temperature and light -rrb- and preventing pests -lrb- primarily insects -rrb- from damaging artefacts . EOS
SOS the other major category is " UNK " conservation , this includes : cleaning and reintegration to strengthen fragile objects , reveal original surface decoration , and restore shape . EOS
SOS conservation is responsible for the long-term preservation of the collections , and covers all the collections held by the v & a and the v & a museum of childhood . EOS
SOS areas covered by UNK 's work include " preventive " conservation this includes : performing surveys , assessments and providing advice on the handling of items , correct packaging , mounting and handling procedures during movement and display to reduce risk of damaging objects . EOS
SOS the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group , a subsidiary of disney media networks division of the walt disney company . EOS
SOS the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group , a subsidiary of disney media networks division of the walt disney company . EOS
SOS the network is headquartered on columbus avenue and west 66th street in manhattan , with additional major offices and production facilities in new york city , los angeles and burbank , california . EOS
SOS the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group , a subsidiary of disney media networks division of the walt disney company . EOS
SOS abc originally launched on october 12 , 1943 as a radio network , separated from and serving as the successor to the nbc blue network , which had been purchased by edward j. noble . EOS
SOS abc originally launched on october 12 , 1943 as a radio network , separated from and serving as the successor to the nbc blue network , which had been purchased by edward j. noble . EOS
SOS it extended its operations to television in 1948 , following in the footsteps of established broadcast networks cbs and nbc . EOS
SOS in the 1980s , after purchasing an 80 % interest in cable sports channel espn , the network 's parent merged with capital cities communications , owner of several print publications , and television and radio stations . EOS

SOS most canadians have access to at least one u.s.-based abc affiliate , either over-the-air -lrb- in areas located within proximity to the canada -- united states border -rrb- or through a cable , satellite or iptv provider , although most abc programs are subject to simultaneous substitution regulations imposed by the canadian radio-television and telecommunications commission that allow pay television providers to replace an american station 's signal with the feed of a canadian broadcaster to protect domestic programming rights and advertising revenue . SOS in 1934 , mutual filed a complaint with the federal communications commission -lrb- fcc -rrb- regarding its difficulties in establishing new stations , in a radio market that was already being saturated by nbc and cbs . EOS
SOS in 1938 , the fcc began a series of investigations into the practices of radio networks and published its report on the broadcasting of network radio programs in 1940 . EOS
SOS in 1938 , the fcc began a series of investigations into the practices of radio networks and published its report on the broadcasting of network radio programs in 1940 . EOS
SOS at that time , the nbc red network was the principal radio network in the united states and , according to the fcc , rca was using nbc blue to eliminate any hint of competition . EOS

SOS abc became an aggressive competitor to nbc and cbs when , continuing nbc blue 's traditions of public service , it aired symphony performances conducted by paul whiteman , performances from the metropolitan opera , and jazz concerts aired as part of its broadcast of the chamber music society of lower basin street announced by milton cross . SOS the arrival of satellite television ended the need for abc to hold interests in other countries ; many governments also wanted to increase their independence and strengthen legislation to limit foreign ownership of broadcasting properties . EOS
